info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 03 at 5:48PM MDT until June 03 at 6:30PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM MDT FOR SOUTH CENTRAL CHEYENNE COUNTY IN EAST CENTRAL COLORADO... At 548 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 13 miles north of Chivington, or 16 miles southwest of Cheyenne Wells, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Cheyenne County in east central Colorado. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
